text: Benjamin Horr House, also known as the Standard Printing Company, is a historic home located at Hannibal, Marion County, Missouri. It was built about 1855, and is a two-story, vernacular Greek Revival style brick structure. It has a front gable roof with cornice. It once housed a private school attended by Mark Twain. and Site map It was added to the National Register of Historic Places in 1986. ==References== Category:Houses on the National Register of Historic Places in Missouri Category:Greek Revival houses in Missouri Category:Houses completed in 1855 Category:Houses in Hannibal, Missouri Category:National Register of Historic Places in Marion County, Missouri
title: Benjamin Horr House
